inputs.name: filePath
inputs.label: File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Required, if Type is FilePath) Path of the script to execute. Must be a fully qualified path or relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Arguments passed to the Bash script.

inputs.name: script
inputs.label: Script
inputs.helpMarkDown:
(Required, if Type is inline) Contents of the script. Default value: "# Write your commands here

echo 'Hello world'
"

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Specify the working directory in which you want to run the command. If you leave it empty, the working directory is $(Build.SourcesDirectory)

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on standard error
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to stderr. Default value: false

inputs.name: noProfile
inputs.label: Don't load the system-wide startup/initialization files
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Don't load the system-wide startup file /etc/profile or any of the personal initialization files

inputs.name: noRc
inputs.label: Don't read the ~/.bashrc file
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) If this is true, the task will not process .bashrc from the user's home directory. Default value: true

inputs.name: env
inputs.label: Environment variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) A list of additional items to map into the process's environment. For example, secret variables are not automatically mapped.
